alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 2:40PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Arizona, including the following county, Coconino. * WHEN...Until 545 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 238 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Little Red Horse Wash, Pipe Creek, Cremation Creek, Grapevine Creek, Bright Angel Wash, Garden Creek, Coconino Wash and Cottonwood Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tusayan, Grand Canyon - South Rim, Grandview Point At Grand Canyon, Ten-x Campground. - This includes State Route 64 between mile markers 227 and 237. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
